intro: Viviania rosea var. laxa, commonly known as the laxa roseum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
